title: Developing Self-Regulated Learning (SRL)-Based Strategies for High School Equivalency Exam (HSEE) Preparation for English Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English proficiency and experience in high school-level English learning
context.additional_context: Learners have prior HSEE exam experience with repeated failures, requiring a curriculum focused on self-regulated learning enhancement. Activities include digital device (tablet/laptop) integration.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze weaknesses in each HSEE (Holistic Student Evaluation) domain and establish specific improvement plans.
Learners can diversify problem-solving strategies by applying flexible learning approaches.
Learners can identify at least three evidence-based learning strategies (e.g., time management, note-taking techniques) and apply them to actual exams.

resources: Mock Exam Sample and Grading Rubric
Digital Learning Tools (Memo App, Timer App)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
